articles.title: Mass Abduction of U.S. Missionaries Startles Even Kidnap-Weary Haiti - The New York Times
articles.description: “Where is this country going?” Gang members seized 16 Americans and one Canadian, among them five children, as they visited an orphanage.

articles.author: VOA Learning English
articles.title: NASA’s Latest Mission to Explore Asteroids Near Jupiter’s Orbit - VOA Learning English
articles.description: The latest mission of the American space agency, NASA, will explore a group of ancient objects orbiting the sun at the distance of Jupiter. Set to launch October 16, the Lucy spacecraft is designed to study Jupiter’s “Trojan” asteroids.
articles.content:

articles.title: Missionary group confirms kidnapping of 16 Americans, one Canadian - News24
articles.description: A missionary group including 16 Americans and one Canadian were kidnapped in Haiti on Saturday while on a trip to an orphanage, the Ohio-based Christian Aid Ministries group said on Sunday.
articles.content:

articles.title: Alouettes trade for QB Trevor Harris - CFL.ca
articles.description: The Montreal Alouettes announced on Sunday that the team has acquired veteran quarterback Trevor Harris from the Edmonton Elks in exchange for American defensive end Antonio Simmons.

articles.title: NASA is studying how to build a Wi-Fi network on the moon, it hopes it could also solve Earth's digital divide - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: A conceptual NASA study explores the idea of a lunar Wi-Fi network to help fix inadequate internet services in American cities, including Cleveland, Ohio.
articles.content:
A new study revealed by NASA considers the possibility of building a lunar Wi-Fi network, the agency reported.
